  physical_appearance: The image shows a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular and it features three people. To the left is a boy who is holding a hat. At the centre is a man who is dressed in robes. Both the man and the boy are wearing their ethnic costumes
 which come with headwear. To the right is a man who is kneeling down and holding an umbrella upright.

  sgcool_label_text: This studio photograph shows a Chinese towkee dressed in robes of a Chinese official
 accompanied by a boy holding a hat
 and his servant holding a parasol. ‘Chinese Towkee 163’ is inscribed on the lower edge of the photograph. The photograph is stamped with the studio mark ‘GR Lambert \u0026 Co Singapore’.\r\n\r\nG.R. Lambert and Co was a leading and the most enduring of the European photography studios in Singapore. The studio was established in 1867 by Gustave Richard Lambert
 who was originally from Dresden
 Germany. Popular among the elites
 the firm was often chosen as the official photographers for important state events in Singapore. In 1861 it was appointed as the official photographer of the King of Siam and the Sultan of Johore.

metadata.sgcool_label_text:
This studio photograph shows a Chinese towkee dressed in robes of a Chinese official, accompanied by a boy holding a hat, and his servant holding a parasol. ‘Chinese Towkee 163’ is inscribed on the lower edge of the photograph. The photograph is stamped with the studio mark ‘GR Lambert & Co Singapore’.

G.R. Lambert and Co was a leading and the most enduring of the European photography studios in Singapore. The studio was established in 1867 by Gustave Richard Lambert, who was originally from Dresden, Germany. Popular among the elites, the firm was often chosen as the official photographers for important state events in Singapore. In 1861 it was appointed as the official photographer of the King of Siam and the Sultan of Johore.
